intro: Fimbristylis tentsuki f. gracillima, commonly known as the slender false spike-rush, is a member of the Cyperaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats, such as marshes and wetlands. Its flowering stems are often slender and may bear tiny, inconspicuous flowers. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia and is often found in disturbed or semi-aquatic environments.
